snippet: The body of knowledge about how the brain works is growing, but so is the list of gaps in our understanding. Larry Abbott, a former theoretical physicist, is looking for models to fill them in.
abstract: Research on brain is surging, but growing body of data represents paradox of progress, with advances also highlighting great gaps in understanding; scientists, who speculate on grand scale but work on limited scale, are struggling to resolve both large and small questions.
lead_paragraph: The body of knowledge about how the brain works is growing, but so is the list of gaps in our understanding. Larry Abbott, a former theoretical physicist, is looking for models to fill them in.

headline.main: Learning How Little We Know About the Brain
